newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Bomb hoax aimed at Australian race row politician.
newsitem.headline: Bomb hoax aimed at Australian race row politician.

text.p: Australian police said on Friday a hoax bomb addressed to race row politician Pauline Hanson had been found at a convention centre where she was expected to speak later next month.
Chief Superintendent Trevor Johnson told reporters the hoax bomb had been left outside the European Convention Centre in the suburbs of the South Australia state capital of Adelaide.
Johnson said a man telephoned a local media organisation on Thursday night and said "there is a bomb at the convention centre where Hanson is to speak".

Police found a box wrapped in brown paper with the word "bomb" written on one side and "For Pauline Hanson, more to come" on another. Inside the package were three containers of flammable liquid but no detonating device.
Johnson said the bomb hoax was "the act of people with a mischievous bent".
Hanson, an independent member in the Australian parliament, is hoping to launch her populist One Nation party in Adelaide, although the venue of the launch has not been announced.
Similar launches in Western Australia and Tasmania were disrupted by protesters, leading to difficulties in finding venues in other states.
Hanson's party opposes further immigration from Asia, wants Aboriginal welfare cut back and supports moves to overturn a national ban on semi-automatic rifles and shotguns.
